title: Asian stocks rally after China announces next round of trade talks with United States
text:
Hong Kong (CNN Business) Stocks in Asia broadly rallied Thursday after Chinese officials announced that they've agreed with the United States to hold another round of trade talks in Washington next month.

Shanghai Composite Index SHCOMP Nikkei N225 Kospi KOSPI Therose 1.5% in early trading, putting on pace for its fourth straight day of gains. Japan'sadvanced 2.4%, while South Korea'srose 1.5%.

China's Commerce Ministry on Thursday announced that the country's Vice Premier and chief trade negotiator Liu He has spoken with US Trade Representative Robert Lighthizer and Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin, and that both sides agreed to meet in Washington in October.

The two sides will continue talking before then, according to the Commerce Ministry.

Dow INDU S&P 500 SPX Nasdaq COMP US futures also rallied during Asia hours. Thewas up 1.1%, or roughly 290 points, while theand theboth advanced more than 1%.
